label: 2018 Nissan Leaf – AZ (High Risk Expected)
reasoning: Air-cooled battery chemistry + extreme Arizona heat + 7 years old + moderate mileage = significant degradation expected. Known battery longevity issues in hot climates.

label: 2020 Chevy Bolt – MI (Moderate Risk Expected)
reasoning: Battery recall era (21V-650, 21V-861 critical fire risk). Cold Michigan climate adds stress. Moderate mileage. Should flag critical recalls and suggest verification of recall completion.

label: 2021 Tesla Model 3 – CA (Good Buy Expected)
reasoning: LFP or NMC811 chemistry, mild Bay Area climate (excellent infrastructure), low mileage for age (~9k/year), home charging. Strong reliability track record. Should score high.

label: 2019 BMW i3 – NY (Moderate Risk Expected)
reasoning: Small 42kWh battery pack + 40 mi/day (high range ratio) + NO home charging in NYC = ownership fit penalty. Cold climate stress. Age/mileage acceptable. Should flag charging infrastructure dependency.

label: 2022 Mustang Mach-E – TX (Borderline Expected)
reasoning: Newer platform (3 years old), but Texas heat stress. Moderate mileage. Some early production quality concerns but no critical recalls. Should be borderline GREEN/YELLOW depending on climate penalty weight.
